body.p: The affient states that he was at the mercer circuit court before James Dudleston was convicted for stabing Lewis Gabbert in a fight and that before said Gabbert was sworn as a witness in the case for the comonwelth he Gabbert offered to compromise the case through esq Hale and that he John Murphy refered Wm Turner to the sad hale
this day came before me John Murphy and made oath to the truth of the above affidavit given inder my hand as a Justice of the Peace this 19th December 1861 in Garrard County

J. H. Totten J.P.G.C.
this 19th of Decmber 1861

William Turner also appeard before me and made oath to the following facts that before the trail of James Dudleston in the mercer circuit court on a charge of stabing Lewis Gabbert the said Turner being refered theo the said Hail by John Murphy and that he the said hale said that Gabbert would take Twelve hundred Dollars and compromise the case and take the case and Duddleston was not able to pay that amount

this day came William Turner also before me and made oath to the truth of the above affidavit given under my hand this 19d of December 1861 as a Justice of the peace for Garrard County This 19th day of December 1861

p.hi: J.. H. Totten J. P. G. C.

body.p:
I state that a few days ago I asked Lewis Gabhart, to sign the Petition for the release of Duddleson, he gave me to understand that he would do so -- and said he would call when he came to Harrosburg & sign it, He came shortly afterwards, & said to me he would sign it if Duddleson would pay him Two Hundred Dollars I told him Duddleson was not able to pay any thing. & then the matter ended between us. Watson
Jan 2 -- 1862,
